name: Lemon-Dill Baked Salmon with Sautéed Asparagus and Almonds
description: Oven-baked salmon with a cool dill yoghurt sauce, served alongside buttery skillet asparagus and toasted almonds. Mild, fast, and family-friendly keto plate.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F. Line a baking tray with foil or parchment.
Pat salmon dry with paper towels.
Zest and juice the lemon; keep zest and juice separate.
cook_steps: Make sauce: In a bowl, combine yoghurt, half the dill, half the minced garlic, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 teaspoon lemon zest, and 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Season with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Chill.
Bake salmon: Place salmon on the tray. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil, season with salt, black pepper, and 1 teaspoon lemon zest. Bake 10–12 minutes, until just opaque and flaky.

Cook asparagus: Heat a large skillet over medium-high. Add butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil. Add asparagus and a pinch of salt and black pepper. Sauté 4–6 minutes until crisp-tender. Stir in remaining minced garlic for the last 30 seconds.
Toast almonds: In a small dry pan over medium heat, toast almonds 2–3 minutes, stirring, until golden. Remove from heat; season with a tiny pinch of salt.
Finish and serve: Plate salmon with asparagus. Spoon dill yoghurt over salmon, sprinkle with remaining fresh dill and toasted almonds. Serve with remaining lemon juice to taste.
